Example timetable specification

Source: R/timetable-data.R
timetable_specification.Rd

Timetable specification containing information about expected journey times

Usage

timetable_specification

Format

train_header

Train ID. This usually contains headcode information

dt_origin

Date and time of service origin

wtt

Scheduled date and time of event

group

Group name

xi

Start point

xk

End point

duration

Scheduled time between xi and xk

type

Type of travel, moving or dwell

j

Segment ID

T_journey

Total journey time across track section

Details

Data frame with 281 rows and 10 columns

See also

calculate_journey_specifications() match_ids() estimate_berth_lengths()

Examples

timetable_specification
#> # A tibble: 281 × 10
#>    train_header dt_origin           wtt                 group        xi    xk   
#>    <chr>        <dttm>              <dttm>              <chr>        <chr> <chr>
#>  1 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 2000-01-01 13:39:00 stopping-all geo6  geo1…
#>  2 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 2000-01-01 13:39:30 stopping-all geo1… geo1…
#>  3 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 2000-01-01 13:42:00 stopping-all geo1… geo1…
#>  4 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 2000-01-01 13:42:30 stopping-all geo1… geo1…
#>  5 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 2000-01-01 13:44:30 stopping-all geo1… geo1…
#>  6 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 2000-01-01 13:45:00 stopping-all geo1… geo1…
#>  7 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 2000-01-01 13:48:00 stopping-all geo1… geo7 
#>  8 108H         2000-01-01 12:55:00 2000-01-01 13:49:00 stopping-all geo7  geo7 
#>  9 109H         2000-01-01 13:25:00 2000-01-01 14:09:00 stopping-all geo6  geo1…
#> 10 109H         2000-01-01 13:25:00 2000-01-01 14:09:30 stopping-all geo1… geo1…
